bcm_tsn_sr_flow_t int int uint8 int *actual_size_in_bits</td >< td > Get the sequence number history bits in the RX flow</td ></tr >< tr >< td > packets with new unicast MAC SA can be learnt by software or hardware learning For software user can use learning mode and copy the packets to CPU If any packet is received due to MAC user needs to create corresponding flows via TSN SR flow APIs (please see \ref tsn_apis_sr_flow) and retrieve the learned(but pending) L2 address to modify this L2 address for TSN/SR functionality. User final ly associates created TSN/SR flows with the L2 address by L2 APIs. Please see the L2 related TSN/SR parameters and flags in \ref l2 . To enable SR hardware learning

endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t int *group_id</td >< td > Create an SR auto learn group</td ></tr >< tr >< td > int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t *config</td >< td > Get the information to specified auto learn group ID</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_traverse_cb void *user_data</td >< td > Traverse all auto learn groups</td ></tr >< tr >< td > int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_config_t *config</td >< td > Get the current status of SR auto learn</td ></tr ></table > section tsn_apis_supervision TSN Supervision A Broadcom proprietary packet match mechanism is provided based on SR HSR PRP protocol as well as Link which supports MAC address and Ether type identification In SR HSR PRP Supervision each DAN node shall multicast a PRP HSR Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceHsrPrpSupervision for detail In each DAN node shall multicast a Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceDot1cbSupervision for detail For link protocols (such as Pause, BPDU, etc.)
 
endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t int *group_id</td >< td > Create an SR auto learn group</td ></tr >< tr >< td > int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t *config</td >< td > Get the information to specified auto learn group ID</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_traverse_cb void *user_data</td >< td > Traverse all auto learn groups</td ></tr >< tr >< td > int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_config_t *config</td >< td > Get the current status of SR auto learn</td ></tr ></table > section tsn_apis_supervision TSN Supervision A Broadcom proprietary packet match mechanism is provided based on SR HSR PRP protocol as well as Link which supports MAC address and Ether type identification In SR HSR PRP Supervision each DAN node shall multicast a PRP HSR Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceHsrPrpSupervision for detail In each DAN node shall multicast a Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceDot1cbSupervision for detail For link SDK provides MAC address configuration for these packets to be identified as link packets and not to be processed as SR packets Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceLinkLocal for detail section tsn_apis_cpu_rx_reason_code TSN SR CPU RX Reason code A Broadcom proprietary threshold mechanism is provided based on TSN counter (port or flow, see XXX) values that can interrupt CPU when each counter exceeds certain chip-wide threshold. Each counter can have a configurable Threshold and when the threshold exceeds the chip can optionally interrupt and if configured send a SR copy of the packet to CPU. For the counter exceeds case
 
endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t int *group_id</td >< td > Create an SR auto learn group</td ></tr >< tr >< td > int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t *config</td >< td > Get the information to specified auto learn group ID</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_traverse_cb void *user_data</td >< td > Traverse all auto learn groups</td ></tr >< tr >< td > int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_config_t *config</td >< td > Get the current status of SR auto learn</td ></tr ></table > section tsn_apis_supervision TSN Supervision A Broadcom proprietary packet match mechanism is provided based on SR HSR PRP protocol as well as Link which supports MAC address and Ether type identification In SR HSR PRP Supervision each DAN node shall multicast a PRP HSR Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceHsrPrpSupervision for detail In each DAN node shall multicast a Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceDot1cbSupervision for detail For link SDK provides MAC address configuration for these packets to be identified as link packets and not to be processed as SR packets Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceLinkLocal for detail section tsn_apis_cpu_rx_reason_code TSN SR CPU RX Reason code A Broadcom proprietary threshold mechanism is provided based on TSN please refer to ref rx_reasons_code_table with enumeration type bcmRxReasonSrCounterExceeded for detail In a SR user specified reason code(1~63) from 6-bit binary encoding(bcmRxReasonSrCopyToCpuBit0~5) are used when a user wants to send a packet to CPU and tell the CPU what was the reason for that SR copy to CPU Action. The user-specified reason code can be configured by field API. Please refer to \ref bcm_field_action_t with enumeration type bcmFieldActionSRCopyToCpu and \ref rx_reasons_code_table with enumeration type bcmRxReasonSrCopyToCpuBit0~5 for detail. \section tsn_apis_stat TSN Statistics Management The bcm TSN module allows the user to collect various statistics regarding traffic flowing in the system. The TSN Statistics Management provides Per-Port counters for All ports. In addition it also provides limited number of counters to do Per-Flow counting. Below are the definitions for various TSN statistic types which are shared by both Per-Port and Per-Flow counters endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_config_t_init (bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_config_t *config)</td >< td > Initialize a TSN statistics threshold configuration structure</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_set(int unit
 Initialize a TSN statistics threshold configuration structure. More...
 
endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t int *group_id</td >< td > Create an SR auto learn group</td ></tr >< tr >< td > int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t *config</td >< td > Get the information to specified auto learn group ID</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_traverse_cb void *user_data</td >< td > Traverse all auto learn groups</td ></tr >< tr >< td > int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_config_t *config</td >< td > Get the current status of SR auto learn</td ></tr ></table > section tsn_apis_supervision TSN Supervision A Broadcom proprietary packet match mechanism is provided based on SR HSR PRP protocol as well as Link which supports MAC address and Ether type identification In SR HSR PRP Supervision each DAN node shall multicast a PRP HSR Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceHsrPrpSupervision for detail In each DAN node shall multicast a Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceDot1cbSupervision for detail For link SDK provides MAC address configuration for these packets to be identified as link packets and not to be processed as SR packets Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceLinkLocal for detail section tsn_apis_cpu_rx_reason_code TSN SR CPU RX Reason code A Broadcom proprietary threshold mechanism is provided based on TSN please refer to ref rx_reasons_code_table with enumeration type bcmRxReasonSrCounterExceeded for detail In a SR user specified reason code(1~63) from 6-bit binary encoding(bcmRxReasonSrCopyToCpuBit0~5) are used when a user wants to send a packet to CPU and tell the CPU what was the reason for that SR copy to CPU Action. The user-specified reason code can be configured by field API. Please refer to \ref bcm_field_action_t with enumeration type bcmFieldActionSRCopyToCpu and \ref rx_reasons_code_table with enumeration type bcmRxReasonSrCopyToCpuBit0~5 for detail. \section tsn_apis_stat TSN Statistics Management The bcm TSN module allows the user to collect various statistics regarding traffic flowing in the system. The TSN Statistics Management provides Per-Port counters for All ports. In addition it also provides limited number of counters to do Per-Flow counting. Below are the definitions for various TSN statistic types which are shared by both Per-Port and Per-Flow counters endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_source_t bcm_tsn_stat_t bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_config_t *config</td >< td > Configure Get threshold for a specific statistics type on a specific source</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_get(int unit, bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_source_t source, bcm_tsn_stat_t stat, bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_config_t *config)</td >< td > Configure/Get threshold for a specific statistics type on a specific source.</td ></tr ></table > \section tsn_apis_event_notification TSN Event Notification TSN event notification APIs provide users to register the callbacks for interested TSN event on system or port or flow basis. The supports of the event type and source are depending on device capabilities. \anchor tsn_bcm_tsn_event_type_t< table >< caption >bcm_tsn_event_type_t endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_event_source_t_init (bcm_tsn_event_source_t *source)</td >< td > Initialize a TSN event source structure</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_event_register(int unit
 Initialize a TSN event source structure. More...
 
endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t int *group_id</td >< td > Create an SR auto learn group</td ></tr >< tr >< td > int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t *config</td >< td > Get the information to specified auto learn group ID</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_traverse_cb void *user_data</td >< td > Traverse all auto learn groups</td ></tr >< tr >< td > int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_config_t *config</td >< td > Get the current status of SR auto learn</td ></tr ></table > section tsn_apis_supervision TSN Supervision A Broadcom proprietary packet match mechanism is provided based on SR HSR PRP protocol as well as Link which supports MAC address and Ether type identification In SR HSR PRP Supervision each DAN node shall multicast a PRP HSR Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceHsrPrpSupervision for detail In each DAN node shall multicast a Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceDot1cbSupervision for detail For link SDK provides MAC address configuration for these packets to be identified as link packets and not to be processed as SR packets Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceLinkLocal for detail section tsn_apis_cpu_rx_reason_code TSN SR CPU RX Reason code A Broadcom proprietary threshold mechanism is provided based on TSN please refer to ref rx_reasons_code_table with enumeration type bcmRxReasonSrCounterExceeded for detail In a SR user specified reason code(1~63) from 6-bit binary encoding(bcmRxReasonSrCopyToCpuBit0~5) are used when a user wants to send a packet to CPU and tell the CPU what was the reason for that SR copy to CPU Action. The user-specified reason code can be configured by field API. Please refer to \ref bcm_field_action_t with enumeration type bcmFieldActionSRCopyToCpu and \ref rx_reasons_code_table with enumeration type bcmRxReasonSrCopyToCpuBit0~5 for detail. \section tsn_apis_stat TSN Statistics Management The bcm TSN module allows the user to collect various statistics regarding traffic flowing in the system. The TSN Statistics Management provides Per-Port counters for All ports. In addition it also provides limited number of counters to do Per-Flow counting. Below are the definitions for various TSN statistic types which are shared by both Per-Port and Per-Flow counters endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_source_t bcm_tsn_stat_t bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_config_t *config</td >< td > Configure Get threshold for a specific statistics type on a specific source</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_get(int unit, bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_source_t source, bcm_tsn_stat_t stat, bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_config_t *config)</td >< td > Configure/Get threshold for a specific statistics type on a specific source.</td ></tr ></table > \section tsn_apis_event_notification TSN Event Notification TSN event notification APIs provide users to register the callbacks for interested TSN event on system or port or flow basis. tsn_apis_supervision TSN Supervision A Broadcom proprietary packet match mechanism is provided based on SR HSR PRP protocol as well as Link which supports MAC address and Ether type identification In SR HSR PRP Supervision each DAN node shall multicast a PRP HSR Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceHsrPrpSupervision for detail In each DAN node shall multicast a Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceDot1cbSupervision for detail For link SDK provides MAC address configuration for these packets to be identified as link packets and not to be processed as SR packets Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceLinkLocal for detail section tsn_apis_cpu_rx_reason_code TSN SR CPU RX Reason code A Broadcom proprietary threshold mechanism is provided based on TSN please refer to ref rx_reasons_code_table with enumeration type bcmRxReasonSrCounterExceeded for detail In a SR user specified reason code(1~63) from 6-bit binary encoding(bcmRxReasonSrCopyToCpuBit0~5) are used when a user wants to send a packet to CPU and tell the CPU what was the reason for that SR copy to CPU Action. The user-specified reason code can be configured by field API. The supports of the event type and source are depending on device capabilities. \anchor tsn_bcm_tsn_event_type_t< table >< caption >bcm_tsn_event_type_t endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_event_type_t bcm_tsn_event_source_t bcm_tsn_event_cb void *user_data</td >< td > Register unregister a callback function for handling TSN events</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_event_notification_traverse_cb void *user_data</td >< td > Traverse all registered event notification callbacks</td ></tr ></table > section tsn_apis_tsn_flow TSN Flows A TSN cut through service MTU STU checking and Time Aware Scheduling Remote nodes or particular streams from remote nodes can be identified as TSN flows by associating L2 addresses Individual TSN flows are identified in SDK as flow ID with type bcm_tsn_tsn_flow_t To support multiple TSN flows with differenet packet priorities sharing the same MAC TSN flow sets(bcm_tsn_tsn_flowset_t) are introduced in SDK to identify a set of TSN flows that are used together to be associated with one L2 address. A TSN flow set can contain only single flow so that packets with the same MAC-DA belong to one TSN flow regardless of the packet priority.< table >< caption >Flags for TSN flow configuration bcm_tsn_flow_config_t</caption >< tr >< td >BCM_TSN_FLOW_CONFIG_DO_NOT_CUT_THROUGH</td >< td >Do not cut-through for the flow</td ></tr ></table > Configuration structure for TSN flows endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_flow_config_t_init (bcm_tsn_flow_config_t *flow_config)</td >< td > Initialize a TSN flow configuration structure</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_flowset_create(int unit
 Initialize a TSN flow configuration structure. More...

The supports of the event type and source are depending on device capabilities. \anchor tsn_bcm_tsn_event_type_t< table >< caption >bcm_tsn_event_type_t endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_event_type_t bcm_tsn_event_source_t bcm_tsn_event_cb void *user_data</td >< td > Register unregister a callback function for handling TSN events</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_event_notification_traverse_cb void *user_data</td >< td > Traverse all registered event notification callbacks</td ></tr ></table > section tsn_apis_tsn_flow TSN Flows A TSN cut through service MTU STU checking and Time Aware Scheduling Remote nodes or particular streams from remote nodes can be identified as TSN flows by associating L2 addresses Individual TSN flows are identified in SDK as flow ID with type bcm_tsn_tsn_flow_t To support multiple TSN flows with differenet packet priorities sharing the same MAC TSN flow sets(bcm_tsn_tsn_flowset_t) are introduced in SDK to identify a set of TSN flows that are used together to be associated with one L2 address. A TSN flow set can contain only single flow so that packets with the same MAC-DA belong to one TSN flow regardless of the packet priority.< table >< caption >Flags for TSN flow configuration bcm_tsn_flow_config_t</caption >< tr >< td >BCM_TSN_FLOW_CONFIG_DO_NOT_CUT_THROUGH</td >< td >Do not cut-through for the flow</td ></tr ></table > Configuration structure for TSN flows endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_pri_map_t bcm_tsn_flow_config_t bcm_tsn_flowset_t *flowset</td >< td > Create a TSN flow set</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_flowset_config_get (int unit, bcm_tsn_flowset_t flowset, bcm_tsn_pri_map_t *pri_map, bcm_tsn_flow_config_t *default_config)</td >< td > Retrieve the initial configuration for a TSN flow set</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_flowset_status_get(int unit

The supports of the event type and source are depending on device capabilities. \anchor tsn_bcm_tsn_event_type_t< table >< caption >bcm_tsn_event_type_t endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_event_type_t bcm_tsn_event_source_t bcm_tsn_event_cb void *user_data</td >< td > Register unregister a callback function for handling TSN events</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_event_notification_traverse_cb void *user_data</td >< td > Traverse all registered event notification callbacks</td ></tr ></table > section tsn_apis_tsn_flow TSN Flows A TSN cut through service MTU STU checking and Time Aware Scheduling Remote nodes or particular streams from remote nodes can be identified as TSN flows by associating L2 addresses Individual TSN flows are identified in SDK as flow ID with type bcm_tsn_tsn_flow_t To support multiple TSN flows with differenet packet priorities sharing the same MAC TSN flow sets(bcm_tsn_tsn_flowset_t) are introduced in SDK to identify a set of TSN flows that are used together to be associated with one L2 address. A TSN flow set can contain only single flow so that packets with the same MAC-DA belong to one TSN flow regardless of the packet priority.< table >< caption >Flags for TSN flow configuration bcm_tsn_flow_config_t</caption >< tr >< td >BCM_TSN_FLOW_CONFIG_DO_NOT_CUT_THROUGH</td >< td >Do not cut-through for the flow</td ></tr ></table > Configuration structure for TSN flows endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_pri_map_t bcm_tsn_flow_config_t bcm_tsn_flowset_t *flowset</td >< td > Create a TSN flow set</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_flowset_t bcm_tsn_flowset_status_t *status</td >< td > Retrieve the current status for a TSN flow set</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_flowset_traverse (int unit, bcm_tsn_flowset_traverse_cb cb, void *user_data)</td >< td > Traverse all the created TSN flow sets</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_flowset_destroy(int unit

> Traverse all auto learn groups</td ></tr >< tr >< td > int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_config_t *config</td >< td > Get the current status of SR auto learn</td ></tr ></table > section tsn_apis_supervision TSN Supervision A Broadcom proprietary packet match mechanism is provided based on SR HSR PRP protocol as well as Link which supports MAC address and Ether type identification In SR HSR PRP Supervision each DAN node shall multicast a PRP HSR Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceHsrPrpSupervision for detail In each DAN node shall multicast a Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceDot1cbSupervision for detail For link SDK provides MAC address configuration for these packets to be identified as link packets and not to be processed as SR packets Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceLinkLocal for detail section tsn_apis_cpu_rx_reason_code TSN SR CPU RX Reason code A Broadcom proprietary threshold mechanism is provided based on TSN please refer to ref rx_reasons_code_table with enumeration type bcmRxReasonSrCounterExceeded for detail In a SR user specified reason code(1~63) from 6-bit binary encoding(bcmRxReasonSrCopyToCpuBit0~5) are used when a user wants to send a packet to CPU and tell the CPU what was the reason for that SR copy to CPU Action. The user-specified reason code can be configured by field API. Please refer to \ref bcm_field_action_t with enumeration type bcmFieldActionSRCopyToCpu and \ref rx_reasons_code_table with enumeration type bcmRxReasonSrCopyToCpuBit0~5 for detail. \section tsn_apis_stat TSN Statistics Management The bcm TSN module allows the user to collect various statistics regarding traffic flowing in the system. The TSN Statistics Management provides Per-Port counters for All ports. In addition it also provides limited number of counters to do Per-Flow counting. Below are the definitions for various TSN statistic types which are shared by both Per-Port and Per-Flow counters endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_source_t bcm_tsn_stat_t bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_config_t *config</td >< td > Configure Get threshold for a specific statistics type on a specific source</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_get(int unit, bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_source_t source, bcm_tsn_stat_t stat, bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_config_t *config)</td >< td > Configure/Get threshold for a specific statistics type on a specific source.</td ></tr ></table > \section tsn_apis_event_notification TSN Event Notification TSN event notification APIs provide users to register the callbacks for interested TSN event on system or port or flow basis. The supports of the event type and source are depending on device capabilities. \anchor tsn_bcm_tsn_event_type_t< table >< caption >bcm_tsn_event_type_t endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_event_type_t bcm_tsn_event_source_t bcm_tsn_event_cb void *user_data</td >< td > Register unregister a callback function for handling TSN events</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_event_notification_traverse_cb void *user_data</td >< td > Traverse all registered event notification callbacks</td ></tr ></table > section tsn_apis_tsn_flow TSN Flows A TSN cut through service MTU STU checking and Time Aware Scheduling Remote nodes or particular streams from remote nodes can be identified as TSN flows by associating L2 addresses Individual TSN flows are identified in SDK as flow ID with type bcm_tsn_tsn_flow_t To support multiple TSN flows with differenet packet priorities sharing the same MAC TSN flow sets(bcm_tsn_tsn_flowset_t) are introduced in SDK to identify a set of TSN flows that are used together to be associated with one L2 address. A TSN flow set can contain only single flow so that packets with the same MAC-DA belong to one TSN flow regardless of the packet priority.< table >< caption >Flags for TSN flow configuration bcm_tsn_flow_config_t</caption >< tr >< td >BCM_TSN_FLOW_CONFIG_DO_NOT_CUT_THROUGH</td >< td >Do not cut-through for the flow</td ></tr ></table > Configuration structure for TSN flows endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_pri_map_t bcm_tsn_flow_config_t bcm_tsn_flowset_t *flowset</td >< td > Create a TSN flow set</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_flowset_t bcm_tsn_flowset_status_t *status</td >< td > Retrieve the current status for a TSN flow set</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_flowset_t flowset</td >< td > Destroy a TSN flow set</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_flowset_flow_get (int unit, bcm_tsn_flowset_t flowset, int index, bcm_tsn_flow_t *flow_id)</td >< td > Retrieve an individual TSN flow ID based on the flow offset from a flow set.</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_flow_config_get(int unit
 Retrieve an individual TSN flow ID based on the flow offset from a flow set. More...

tsn_apis_supervision TSN Supervision A Broadcom proprietary packet match mechanism is provided based on SR HSR PRP protocol as well as Link which supports MAC address and Ether type identification In SR HSR PRP Supervision each DAN node shall multicast a PRP HSR Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceHsrPrpSupervision for detail In each DAN node shall multicast a Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceDot1cbSupervision for detail For link SDK provides MAC address configuration for these packets to be identified as link packets and not to be processed as SR packets Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceLinkLocal for detail section tsn_apis_cpu_rx_reason_code TSN SR CPU RX Reason code A Broadcom proprietary threshold mechanism is provided based on TSN please refer to ref rx_reasons_code_table with enumeration type bcmRxReasonSrCounterExceeded for detail In a SR user specified reason code(1~63) from 6-bit binary encoding(bcmRxReasonSrCopyToCpuBit0~5) are used when a user wants to send a packet to CPU and tell the CPU what was the reason for that SR copy to CPU Action. The user-specified reason code can be configured by field API. Please refer to \ref bcm_field_action_t with enumeration type bcmFieldActionSRCopyToCpu and \ref rx_reasons_code_table with enumeration type bcmRxReasonSrCopyToCpuBit0~5 for detail. \section tsn_apis_stat TSN Statistics Management The bcm TSN module allows the user to collect various statistics regarding traffic flowing in the system. Below are the definitions for various TSN statistic types which are shared by both Per-Port and Per-Flow counters endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_source_t bcm_tsn_stat_t bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_config_t *config</td >< td > Configure Get threshold for a specific statistics type on a specific source</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_get(int unit, bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_source_t source, bcm_tsn_stat_t stat, bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_config_t *config)</td >< td > Configure/Get threshold for a specific statistics type on a specific source.</td ></tr ></table > \section tsn_apis_event_notification TSN Event Notification TSN event notification APIs provide users to register the callbacks for interested TSN event on system or port or flow basis. The supports of the event type and source are depending on device capabilities. \anchor tsn_bcm_tsn_event_type_t< table >< caption >bcm_tsn_event_type_t endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_event_type_t bcm_tsn_event_source_t bcm_tsn_event_cb void *user_data</td >< td > Register unregister a callback function for handling TSN events</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_event_notification_traverse_cb void *user_data</td >< td > Traverse all registered event notification callbacks</td ></tr ></table > section tsn_apis_tsn_flow TSN Flows A TSN cut through service MTU STU checking and Time Aware Scheduling Remote nodes or particular streams from remote nodes can be identified as TSN flows by associating L2 addresses Individual TSN flows are identified in SDK as flow ID with type bcm_tsn_tsn_flow_t To support multiple TSN flows with differenet packet priorities sharing the same MAC TSN flow sets(bcm_tsn_tsn_flowset_t) are introduced in SDK to identify a set of TSN flows that are used together to be associated with one L2 address. A TSN flow set can contain only single flow so that packets with the same MAC-DA belong to one TSN flow regardless of the packet priority.< table >< caption >Flags for TSN flow configuration bcm_tsn_flow_config_t</caption >< tr >< td >BCM_TSN_FLOW_CONFIG_DO_NOT_CUT_THROUGH</td >< td >Do not cut-through for the flow</td ></tr ></table > Configuration structure for TSN flows endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_pri_map_t bcm_tsn_flow_config_t bcm_tsn_flowset_t *flowset</td >< td > Create a TSN flow set</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_flowset_t bcm_tsn_flowset_status_t *status</td >< td > Retrieve the current status for a TSN flow set</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_flowset_t flowset</td >< td > Destroy a TSN flow set</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_flow_t bcm_tsn_flow_config_t *config</td >< td > Retrieve the flow configuration for a TSN flow</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_flow_config_set (int unit, bcm_tsn_flow_t flow_id, bcm_tsn_flow_config_t *config)</td >< td > Set(modify) the flow configuration for a TSN flow</td ></tr ></table > \section tsn_apis_mtu_stu TSN MTU and STU Management The bcm TSN module allows the user to set up MTU(Maximum Transmission Unit) size check and decide whether to drop the packet or just increase MTU error count when the packet exceeds the MTU Size. It also support STU(Shortest Transmission Unit) size check and decide whether to drop the packet or just increase STU error count when the packet is below the shortest transmission size. The MTU and STU management provides set/get/destroy/traverse API to manage the MTU/STU profile. Also for ingress side
 Set (modify) the flow configuration for a TSN flow. More...

TAF ensures that frames belonging to a stream are allowed to pass through a network element only during a specified time slot. It deals with frame filtering
 Get the global configuration for ingress STU source priority sequence. More...
 
endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_mtu_profile_type_t bcm_tsn_mtu_config_t int *mtu_profile_id</td >< td > Create an MTU profile with the config file and return the assigned profile id</td ></tr >< tr >< td > int bcm_tsn_mtu_config_t *config</td >< td > Set the existing MTU profile with the profile id and config file</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_mtu_profile_traverse_cb void *user_data</td >< td > Traverse the created MTU profile</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_ingress_mtu_config_t *config</td >< td > Set up global configuration for ingress including the priority of the following SR flow and TSN flow</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_stu_profile_type_t bcm_tsn_stu_config_t int *stu_profile_id</td >< td > Create an STU profile with the config file and return the assigned profile id</td ></tr >< tr >< td > int bcm_tsn_stu_config_t *config</td >< td > Set the existing STU profile with the profile id and config file</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_stu_profile_traverse_cb void *user_data</td >< td > Traverse the created STU profile</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_ingress_stu_config_t *config</td >< td > Set up global configuration for ingress including the priority of the following VFP</td ></tr >< tr >< td > time aware frame metering policing and service class selections for frames of specific data streams TAF APIs provide the device configuration interface status error handling and profile management to support IEEE802 Qci Callback mechanisms are also provided for notifying the application of TAF events TAF profile managements APIs provide the interface to management the gate state calendars and the corresponding time information (available in PTP mode) as profiles to mitigate the time sensitive configuration const rains in device. \subsection taf_data_types TAF Data Types - bcm_tsn_taf_control_t is an enumeration of the TAF control types - bcm_tsn_taf_status_t is an enumeration of the TAF status types - bcm_tsn_taf_profile_id_t is an identifier used to refer to a TAF profile. - bcm_tsn_taf_profile_t is a structure containing information about an TAF profile. - bcm_tsn_taf_entry_t is a structure contanining information about an entry in TAF profile. - bcm_tsn_taf_profile_state_t is an enumeration of the TAF profile state - bcm_tsn_taf_profile_status_t is a structure contanining information about the status of TAF profile. - bcm_tsn_taf_event_types_t is a bit array containing multiple event \subsection taf_gate TAF Gate Allocation We need to create one or several TAF gates that we need first. Then we would create a TAF gate priority mapping configuration. In this configuration
 
endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_mtu_profile_type_t bcm_tsn_mtu_config_t int *mtu_profile_id</td >< td > Create an MTU profile with the config file and return the assigned profile id</td ></tr >< tr >< td > int bcm_tsn_mtu_config_t *config</td >< td > Set the existing MTU profile with the profile id and config file</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_mtu_profile_traverse_cb void *user_data</td >< td > Traverse the created MTU profile</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_ingress_mtu_config_t *config</td >< td > Set up global configuration for ingress including the priority of the following SR flow and TSN flow</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_stu_profile_type_t bcm_tsn_stu_config_t int *stu_profile_id</td >< td > Create an STU profile with the config file and return the assigned profile id</td ></tr >< tr >< td > int bcm_tsn_stu_config_t *config</td >< td > Set the existing STU profile with the profile id and config file</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_stu_profile_traverse_cb void *user_data</td >< td > Traverse the created STU profile</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_ingress_stu_config_t *config</td >< td > Set up global configuration for ingress including the priority of the following VFP</td ></tr >< tr >< td > time aware frame metering policing and service class selections for frames of specific data streams TAF APIs provide the device configuration interface status error handling and profile management to support IEEE802 Qci Callback mechanisms are also provided for notifying the application of TAF events TAF profile managements APIs provide the interface to management the gate state calendars and the corresponding time It describes the mapping relationship between various priority values (0 ~ 15) and TAF gate. See \ref tsn_apis_priority_map< table >< tr >< th >API</th >< th >Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_taf_gate_create(int unit

endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t int *group_id</td >< td > Create an SR auto learn group</td ></tr >< tr >< td > int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t *config</td >< td > Get the information to specified auto learn group ID</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_traverse_cb void *user_data</td >< td > Traverse all auto learn groups</td ></tr >< tr >< td > int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_config_t *config</td >< td > Get the current status of SR auto learn</td ></tr ></table > section tsn_apis_supervision TSN Supervision A Broadcom proprietary packet match mechanism is provided based on SR HSR PRP protocol as well as Link protocol
 
endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t int *group_id</td >< td > Create an SR auto learn group</td ></tr >< tr >< td > int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t *config</td >< td > Get the information to specified auto learn group ID</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_traverse_cb void *user_data</td >< td > Traverse all auto learn groups</td ></tr >< tr >< td > int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_config_t *config</td >< td > Get the current status of SR auto learn</td ></tr ></table > section tsn_apis_supervision TSN Supervision A Broadcom proprietary packet match mechanism is provided based on SR HSR PRP protocol as well as Link which supports MAC address and Ether type identification In SR HSR PRP Supervision each DAN node shall multicast a PRP HSR Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceHsrPrpSupervision for detail In each DAN node shall multicast a Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceDot1cbSupervision for detail For link SDK provides MAC address configuration for these packets to be identified as link packets and not to be processed as SR packets Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceLinkLocal for detail section tsn_apis_cpu_rx_reason_code TSN SR CPU RX Reason code A Broadcom proprietary threshold mechanism is provided based on TSN please refer to ref rx_reasons_code_table with enumeration type bcmRxReasonSrCounterExceeded for detail In addition
 
endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t int *group_id</td >< td > Create an SR auto learn group</td ></tr >< tr >< td > int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t *config</td >< td > Get the information to specified auto learn group ID</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_traverse_cb void *user_data</td >< td > Traverse all auto learn groups</td ></tr >< tr >< td > int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_config_t *config</td >< td > Get the current status of SR auto learn</td ></tr ></table > section tsn_apis_supervision TSN Supervision A Broadcom proprietary packet match mechanism is provided based on SR HSR PRP protocol as well as Link which supports MAC address and Ether type identification In SR HSR PRP Supervision each DAN node shall multicast a PRP HSR Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceHsrPrpSupervision for detail In each DAN node shall multicast a Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceDot1cbSupervision for detail For link SDK provides MAC address configuration for these packets to be identified as link packets and not to be processed as SR packets Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceLinkLocal for detail section tsn_apis_cpu_rx_reason_code TSN SR CPU RX Reason code A Broadcom proprietary threshold mechanism is provided based on TSN please refer to ref rx_reasons_code_table with enumeration type bcmRxReasonSrCounterExceeded for detail In a SR user specified reason code(1~63) from 6-bit binary encoding(bcmRxReasonSrCopyToCpuBit0~5) are used when a user wants to send a packet to CPU and tell the CPU what was the reason for that SR copy to CPU Action. The user-specified reason code can be configured by field API. Please refer to \ref bcm_field_action_t with enumeration type bcmFieldActionSRCopyToCpu and \ref rx_reasons_code_table with enumeration type bcmRxReasonSrCopyToCpuBit0~5 for detail. \section tsn_apis_stat TSN Statistics Management The bcm TSN module allows the user to collect various statistics regarding traffic flowing in the system. The TSN Statistics Management provides Per-Port counters for All ports. In addition it also provides limited number of counters to do Per-Flow counting. Below are the definitions for various TSN statistic types which are shared by both Per-Port and Per-Flow counters endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_source_t source
 
endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t int *group_id</td >< td > Create an SR auto learn group</td ></tr >< tr >< td > int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t *config</td >< td > Get the information to specified auto learn group ID</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_traverse_cb void *user_data</td >< td > Traverse all auto learn groups</td ></tr >< tr >< td > int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_config_t *config</td >< td > Get the current status of SR auto learn</td ></tr ></table > section tsn_apis_supervision TSN Supervision A Broadcom proprietary packet match mechanism is provided based on SR HSR PRP protocol as well as Link which supports MAC address and Ether type identification In SR HSR PRP Supervision each DAN node shall multicast a PRP HSR Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceHsrPrpSupervision for detail In each DAN node shall multicast a Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceDot1cbSupervision for detail For link SDK provides MAC address configuration for these packets to be identified as link packets and not to be processed as SR packets Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceLinkLocal for detail section tsn_apis_cpu_rx_reason_code TSN SR CPU RX Reason code A Broadcom proprietary threshold mechanism is provided based on TSN please refer to ref rx_reasons_code_table with enumeration type bcmRxReasonSrCounterExceeded for detail In a SR user specified reason code(1~63) from 6-bit binary encoding(bcmRxReasonSrCopyToCpuBit0~5) are used when a user wants to send a packet to CPU and tell the CPU what was the reason for that SR copy to CPU Action. The user-specified reason code can be configured by field API. Please refer to \ref bcm_field_action_t with enumeration type bcmFieldActionSRCopyToCpu and \ref rx_reasons_code_table with enumeration type bcmRxReasonSrCopyToCpuBit0~5 for detail. \section tsn_apis_stat TSN Statistics Management The bcm TSN module allows the user to collect various statistics regarding traffic flowing in the system. The TSN Statistics Management provides Per-Port counters for All ports. In addition it also provides limited number of counters to do Per-Flow counting. Below are the definitions for various TSN statistic types which are shared by both Per-Port and Per-Flow counters endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_source_t bcm_tsn_stat_t stat
 
endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t int *group_id</td >< td > Create an SR auto learn group</td ></tr >< tr >< td > int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t *config</td >< td > Get the information to specified auto learn group ID</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_traverse_cb void *user_data</td >< td > Traverse all auto learn groups</td ></tr >< tr >< td > int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_config_t *config</td >< td > Get the current status of SR auto learn</td ></tr ></table > section tsn_apis_supervision TSN Supervision A Broadcom proprietary packet match mechanism is provided based on SR HSR PRP protocol as well as Link which supports MAC address and Ether type identification In SR HSR PRP Supervision each DAN node shall multicast a PRP HSR Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceHsrPrpSupervision for detail In each DAN node shall multicast a Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceDot1cbSupervision for detail For link SDK provides MAC address configuration for these packets to be identified as link packets and not to be processed as SR packets Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceLinkLocal for detail section tsn_apis_cpu_rx_reason_code TSN SR CPU RX Reason code A Broadcom proprietary threshold mechanism is provided based on TSN please refer to ref rx_reasons_code_table with enumeration type bcmRxReasonSrCounterExceeded for detail In a SR user specified reason code(1~63) from 6-bit binary encoding(bcmRxReasonSrCopyToCpuBit0~5) are used when a user wants to send a packet to CPU and tell the CPU what was the reason for that SR copy to CPU Action. The user-specified reason code can be configured by field API. Please refer to \ref bcm_field_action_t with enumeration type bcmFieldActionSRCopyToCpu and \ref rx_reasons_code_table with enumeration type bcmRxReasonSrCopyToCpuBit0~5 for detail. \section tsn_apis_stat TSN Statistics Management The bcm TSN module allows the user to collect various statistics regarding traffic flowing in the system. The TSN Statistics Management provides Per-Port counters for All ports. In addition it also provides limited number of counters to do Per-Flow counting. Below are the definitions for various TSN statistic types which are shared by both Per-Port and Per-Flow counters endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_source_t bcm_tsn_stat_t bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_config_t *config</td >< td > Configure Get threshold for a specific statistics type on a specific source</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_get(int unit, bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_source_t source, bcm_tsn_stat_t stat, bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_config_t *config)</td >< td > Configure/Get threshold for a specific statistics type on a specific source.</td ></tr ></table > \section tsn_apis_event_notification TSN Event Notification TSN event notification APIs provide users to register the callbacks for interested TSN event on system or port or flow basis. The supports of the event type and source are depending on device capabilities. \anchor tsn_bcm_tsn_event_type_t< table >< caption >bcm_tsn_event_type_t endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_event_type_t event

Below are the definitions for various TSN statistic types which are shared by both Per-Port and Per-Flow counters endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_source_t bcm_tsn_stat_t bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_config_t *config</td >< td > Configure Get threshold for a specific statistics type on a specific source</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_get(int unit, bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_source_t source, bcm_tsn_stat_t stat, bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_config_t *config)</td >< td > Configure/Get threshold for a specific statistics type on a specific source.</td ></tr ></table > \section tsn_apis_event_notification TSN Event Notification TSN event notification APIs provide users to register the callbacks for interested TSN event on system or port or flow basis. The supports of the event type and source are depending on device capabilities. \anchor tsn_bcm_tsn_event_type_t< table >< caption >bcm_tsn_event_type_t endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_event_type_t bcm_tsn_event_source_t bcm_tsn_event_cb void *user_data</td >< td > Register unregister a callback function for handling TSN events</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_event_notification_traverse_cb void *user_data</td >< td > Traverse all registered event notification callbacks</td ></tr ></table > section tsn_apis_tsn_flow TSN Flows A TSN cut through service MTU STU checking and Time Aware Scheduling Remote nodes or particular streams from remote nodes can be identified as TSN flows by associating L2 addresses Individual TSN flows are identified in SDK as flow ID with type bcm_tsn_tsn_flow_t To support multiple TSN flows with differenet packet priorities sharing the same MAC TSN flow sets(bcm_tsn_tsn_flowset_t) are introduced in SDK to identify a set of TSN flows that are used together to be associated with one L2 address. A TSN flow set can contain only single flow so that packets with the same MAC-DA belong to one TSN flow regardless of the packet priority.< table >< caption >Flags for TSN flow configuration bcm_tsn_flow_config_t</caption >< tr >< td >BCM_TSN_FLOW_CONFIG_DO_NOT_CUT_THROUGH</td >< td >Do not cut-through for the flow</td ></tr ></table > Configuration structure for TSN flows endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_pri_map_t bcm_tsn_flow_config_t bcm_tsn_flowset_t *flowset</td >< td > Create a TSN flow set</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_flowset_t bcm_tsn_flowset_status_t *status</td >< td > Retrieve the current status for a TSN flow set</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_flowset_t flowset</td >< td > Destroy a TSN flow set</td ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_flow_t bcm_tsn_flow_config_t *config</td >< td > Retrieve the flow configuration for a TSN flow</td ></tr >< tr >< td > it provides priority set get API to choose profile from which source has higher priority to reference MTU STU profile with its profile index anchor tsn_bcm_tsn_mtu_profile_type_t< table >< caption > bcm_tsn_mtu_profile_type_t
 
int source_order_count
 
 bcm_tsn_ingress_mtu_config_t
 
endcode anchor tsn_bcm_tsn_stu_profile_type_t< table >< caption > bcm_tsn_stu_profile_type_t
 
 bcm_tsn_ingress_stu_config_t
 
endcode< table >< tr >< th > API</th >< th > Brief</th ></tr >< tr >< td > bcm_tsn_mtu_profile_type_t bcm_tsn_mtu_config_t int *mtu_profile_id</td >< td > Create an MTU profile with the config file and return the assigned profile id</td ></tr >< tr >< td > int mtu_profile_id

with new unicast MAC SA can be learnt by software or hardware learning For software user can use learning mode and copy the packets to CPU If any packet is received due to MAC user needs to create corresponding flows via TSN SR flow APIs ( please see \ref  tsn_apis_sr_flow)

◆ counter()

endcode<table><tr><th> API</th><th> Brief</th></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t int* group_id</td><td> Create an SR auto learn group</td></tr><tr><td> int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t* config</td><td> Get the information to specified auto learn group ID</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_traverse_cb void* user_data</td><td> Traverse all auto learn groups</td></tr><tr><td> int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_config_t* config</td><td> Get the current status of SR auto learn</td></tr></table> section tsn_apis_supervision TSN Supervision A Broadcom proprietary packet match mechanism is provided based on SR HSR PRP protocol as well as Link which supports MAC address and Ether type identification In SR HSR PRP Supervision each DAN node shall multicast a PRP HSR Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceHsrPrpSupervision for detail In each DAN node shall multicast a Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceDot1cbSupervision for detail For link SDK provides MAC address configuration for these packets to be identified as link packets and not to be processed as SR packets Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceLinkLocal for detail section tsn_apis_cpu_rx_reason_code TSN SR CPU RX Reason code A Broadcom proprietary threshold mechanism is provided based on TSN counter ( port or  flow,
see  XXX 
)

◆ flow()

endcode<table><tr><th> API</th><th> Brief</th></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t int* group_id</td><td> Create an SR auto learn group</td></tr><tr><td> int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t* config</td><td> Get the information to specified auto learn group ID</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_traverse_cb void* user_data</td><td> Traverse all auto learn groups</td></tr><tr><td> int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_config_t* config</td><td> Get the current status of SR auto learn</td></tr></table> section tsn_apis_supervision TSN Supervision A Broadcom proprietary packet match mechanism is provided based on SR HSR PRP protocol as well as Link which supports MAC address and Ether type identification In SR HSR PRP Supervision each DAN node shall multicast a PRP HSR Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceHsrPrpSupervision for detail In each DAN node shall multicast a Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceDot1cbSupervision for detail For link SDK provides MAC address configuration for these packets to be identified as link packets and not to be processed as SR packets Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceLinkLocal for detail section tsn_apis_cpu_rx_reason_code TSN SR CPU RX Reason code A Broadcom proprietary threshold mechanism is provided based on TSN please refer to ref rx_reasons_code_table with enumeration type bcmRxReasonSrCounterExceeded for detail In a SR user specified reason code (1~63) from 6-bit binary encoding (bcmRxReasonSrCopyToCpuBit0~5) are used when a user wants to send a packet to CPU and tell the CPU what was the reason for that SR copy to CPU Action. The user-specified reason code can be configured by field API. Please refer to \ref bcm_field_action_t with enumeration type bcmFieldActionSRCopyToCpu and \ref rx_reasons_code_table with enumeration type bcmRxReasonSrCopyToCpuBit0~5 for detail. \section tsn_apis_stat TSN Statistics Management The bcm TSN module allows the user to collect various statistics regarding traffic flowing in the system. The TSN Statistics Management provides Per-Port counters for All ports. In addition it also provides limited number of counters to do Per-Flow counting. Below are the definitions for various TSN statistic types which are shared by both Per-Port and Per-Flow counters endcode<table><tr><th> API</th><th> Brief</th></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_source_t bcm_tsn_stat_t bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_config_t* config</td><td> Configure Get threshold for a specific statistics type on a specific source</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_get (int unit, bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_source_t source, bcm_tsn_stat_t stat, bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_config_t* config) </td> <td> Configure/Get threshold for a specific statistics type on a specific source. </td> </tr> </table> \section tsn_apis_event_notification TSN Event Notification TSN event notification APIs provide users to register the callbacks for interested TSN event on system or port or flow basis. The supports of the event type and source are depending on device capabilities. \anchor tsn_bcm_tsn_event_type_t <table> <caption>bcm_tsn_event_type_t endcode<table><tr><th> API</th><th> Brief</th></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_event_type_t bcm_tsn_event_source_t bcm_tsn_event_cb void* user_data</td><td> Register unregister a callback function for handling TSN events</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_event_notification_traverse_cb void* user_data</td><td> Traverse all registered event notification callbacks</td></tr></table> section tsn_apis_tsn_flow TSN Flows A TSN flow ( or "TSN streams"  ,
"TSN Circuit ID"   
)

◆ information()

endcode<table><tr><th> API</th><th> Brief</th></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_mtu_profile_type_t bcm_tsn_mtu_config_t int* mtu_profile_id</td><td> Create an MTU profile with the config file and return the assigned profile id</td></tr><tr><td> int bcm_tsn_mtu_config_t* config</td><td> Set the existing MTU profile with the profile id and config file</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_mtu_profile_traverse_cb void* user_data</td><td> Traverse the created MTU profile</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_ingress_mtu_config_t* config</td><td> Set up global configuration for ingress including the priority of the following SR flow and TSN flow</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_stu_profile_type_t bcm_tsn_stu_config_t int* stu_profile_id</td><td> Create an STU profile with the config file and return the assigned profile id</td></tr><tr><td> int bcm_tsn_stu_config_t* config</td><td> Set the existing STU profile with the profile id and config file</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_stu_profile_traverse_cb void* user_data</td><td> Traverse the created STU profile</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_ingress_stu_config_t* config</td><td> Set up global configuration for ingress including the priority of the following VFP</td></tr><tr><td> time aware frame metering policing and service class selections for frames of specific data streams TAF APIs provide the device configuration interface status error handling and profile management to support IEEE802 Qci Callback mechanisms are also provided for notifying the application of TAF events TAF profile managements APIs provide the interface to management the gate state calendars and the corresponding time information ( available in PTP  mode) const

◆ mapping()

</td></tr><tr><td> bcmTsnControlTafGatePriMap</td><td> TAF gate priority mapping ( per-  port)

◆ mode()

endcode<table><tr><th> API</th><th> Brief</th></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_pri_map_config_t bcm_tsn_pri_map_t* map_id</td><td> Create a Priority Map ID object</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_pri_map_t with new unicast MAC SA can be learnt by software or hardware learning For software user can use learning mode and copy the packets to CPU If any packet is received due to MAC user needs to create corresponding flows via TSN SR flow SR auto learn software learning should not be done if the system is to run in SR auto learn mode ( Please see the detail in \ref  tsn_apis_auto_learn)

◆ protocols()

endcode<table><tr><th> API</th><th> Brief</th></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t int* group_id</td><td> Create an SR auto learn group</td></tr><tr><td> int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t* config</td><td> Get the information to specified auto learn group ID</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_traverse_cb void* user_data</td><td> Traverse all auto learn groups</td></tr><tr><td> int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_config_t* config</td><td> Get the current status of SR auto learn</td></tr></table> section tsn_apis_supervision TSN Supervision A Broadcom proprietary packet match mechanism is provided based on SR HSR PRP protocol as well as Link which supports MAC address and Ether type identification In SR HSR PRP Supervision each DAN node shall multicast a PRP HSR Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceHsrPrpSupervision for detail In each DAN node shall multicast a Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceDot1cbSupervision for detail For link protocols ( such as  Pause,
BPDU  ,
etc.   
)

endcode<table><tr><th> API</th><th> Brief</th></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_mtu_profile_type_t bcm_tsn_mtu_config_t int* mtu_profile_id</td><td> Create an MTU profile with the config file and return the assigned profile id</td></tr><tr><td> int bcm_tsn_mtu_config_t* config</td><td> Set the existing MTU profile with the profile id and config file</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_mtu_profile_traverse_cb void* user_data</td><td> Traverse the created MTU profile</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_ingress_mtu_config_t* config</td><td> Set up global configuration for ingress including the priority of the following SR flow and TSN flow</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_stu_profile_type_t bcm_tsn_stu_config_t int* stu_profile_id</td><td> Create an STU profile with the config file and return the assigned profile id</td></tr><tr><td> int bcm_tsn_stu_config_t* config</td><td> Set the existing STU profile with the profile id and config file</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_stu_profile_traverse_cb void* user_data</td><td> Traverse the created STU profile</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_ingress_stu_config_t* config</td><td> Set up global configuration for ingress including the priority of the following VFP</td></tr><tr><td> time aware frame metering policing and service class selections for frames of specific data streams TAF APIs provide the device configuration interface status error handling and profile management to support IEEE802 Qci Callback mechanisms are also provided for notifying the application of TAF events TAF profile managements APIs provide the interface to management the gate state calendars and the corresponding time It describes the mapping relationship between various priority values ( 0 ~  15)

endcode<table><tr><th> API</th><th> Brief</th></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t int* group_id</td><td> Create an SR auto learn group</td></tr><tr><td> int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t* config</td><td> Get the information to specified auto learn group ID</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_traverse_cb void* user_data</td><td> Traverse all auto learn groups</td></tr><tr><td> int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_config_t* config</td><td> Get the current status of SR auto learn</td></tr></table> section tsn_apis_supervision TSN Supervision A Broadcom proprietary packet match mechanism is provided based on SR HSR PRP protocol as well as Link which supports MAC address and Ether type identification In SR HSR PRP Supervision each DAN node shall multicast a PRP HSR Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceHsrPrpSupervision for detail In each DAN node shall multicast a Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceDot1cbSupervision for detail For link SDK provides MAC address configuration for these packets to be identified as link packets and not to be processed as SR packets Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceLinkLocal for detail section tsn_apis_cpu_rx_reason_code TSN SR CPU RX Reason code A Broadcom proprietary threshold mechanism is provided based on TSN please refer to ref rx_reasons_code_table with enumeration type bcmRxReasonSrCounterExceeded for detail In addition

◆ bcm_tsn_mtu_profile_type_t

endcode<table><tr><th> API</th><th> Brief</th></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t int* group_id</td><td> Create an SR auto learn group</td></tr><tr><td> int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t* config</td><td> Get the information to specified auto learn group ID</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_traverse_cb void* user_data</td><td> Traverse all auto learn groups</td></tr><tr><td> int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_config_t* config</td><td> Get the current status of SR auto learn</td></tr></table> section tsn_apis_supervision TSN Supervision A Broadcom proprietary packet match mechanism is provided based on SR HSR PRP protocol as well as Link which supports MAC address and Ether type identification In SR HSR PRP Supervision each DAN node shall multicast a PRP HSR Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceHsrPrpSupervision for detail In each DAN node shall multicast a Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceDot1cbSupervision for detail For link SDK provides MAC address configuration for these packets to be identified as link packets and not to be processed as SR packets Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceLinkLocal for detail section tsn_apis_cpu_rx_reason_code TSN SR CPU RX Reason code A Broadcom proprietary threshold mechanism is provided based on TSN please refer to ref rx_reasons_code_table with enumeration type bcmRxReasonSrCounterExceeded for detail In a SR user specified reason code (1~63) from 6-bit binary encoding (bcmRxReasonSrCopyToCpuBit0~5) are used when a user wants to send a packet to CPU and tell the CPU what was the reason for that SR copy to CPU Action. The user-specified reason code can be configured by field API. Please refer to \ref bcm_field_action_t with enumeration type bcmFieldActionSRCopyToCpu and \ref rx_reasons_code_table with enumeration type bcmRxReasonSrCopyToCpuBit0~5 for detail. \section tsn_apis_stat TSN Statistics Management The bcm TSN module allows the user to collect various statistics regarding traffic flowing in the system. The TSN Statistics Management provides Per-Port counters for All ports. In addition it also provides limited number of counters to do Per-Flow counting. Below are the definitions for various TSN statistic types which are shared by both Per-Port and Per-Flow counters endcode<table><tr><th> API</th><th> Brief</th></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_source_t bcm_tsn_stat_t bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_config_t* config</td><td> Configure Get threshold for a specific statistics type on a specific source</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_get (int unit, bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_source_t source, bcm_tsn_stat_t stat, bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_config_t* config) </td> <td> Configure/Get threshold for a specific statistics type on a specific source. </td> </tr> </table> \section tsn_apis_event_notification TSN Event Notification TSN event notification APIs provide users to register the callbacks for interested TSN event on system or port or flow basis. The supports of the event type and source are depending on device capabilities. \anchor tsn_bcm_tsn_event_type_t <table> <caption>bcm_tsn_event_type_t endcode<table><tr><th> API</th><th> Brief</th></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_event_type_t bcm_tsn_event_source_t bcm_tsn_event_cb void* user_data</td><td> Register unregister a callback function for handling TSN events</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_event_notification_traverse_cb void* user_data</td><td> Traverse all registered event notification callbacks</td></tr></table> section tsn_apis_tsn_flow TSN Flows A TSN cut through service MTU STU checking and Time Aware Scheduling Remote nodes or particular streams from remote nodes can be identified as TSN flows by associating L2 addresses Individual TSN flows are identified in SDK as flow ID with type bcm_tsn_tsn_flow_t To support multiple TSN flows with differenet packet priorities sharing the same MAC TSN flow sets (bcm_tsn_tsn_flowset_t) are introduced in SDK to identify a set of TSN flows that are used together to be associated with one L2 address. A TSN flow set can contain only single flow so that packets with the same MAC-DA belong to one TSN flow regardless of the packet priority. <table> <caption>Flags for TSN flow configuration bcm_tsn_flow_config_t</caption> <tr> <td>BCM_TSN_FLOW_CONFIG_DO_NOT_CUT_THROUGH</td> <td>Do not cut-through for the flow</td> </tr> </table> Configuration structure for TSN flows endcode<table><tr><th> API</th><th> Brief</th></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_pri_map_t bcm_tsn_flow_config_t bcm_tsn_flowset_t* flowset</td><td> Create a TSN flow set</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_flowset_t bcm_tsn_flowset_status_t* status</td><td> Retrieve the current status for a TSN flow set</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_flowset_t flowset</td><td> Destroy a TSN flow set</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_flow_t bcm_tsn_flow_config_t* config</td><td> Retrieve the flow configuration for a TSN flow</td></tr><tr><td> it provides priority set get API to choose profile from which source has higher priority to reference MTU STU profile with its profile index anchor tsn_bcm_tsn_mtu_profile_type_t<table><caption> bcm_tsn_mtu_profile_type_t

endcode bcm_tsn_stu_config_t Structure used for STU profile configuration code

#include <bcm/tsn.h>
typedef enum bcm_tsn_pri_map_type_e {
bcmTsnPriMapTypeTsnFlow = 0,
bcmTsnPriMapTypeSrFlow = 1,
bcmTsnPriMapTypeEgressMtuProfile = 2,
bcmTsnPriMapTypeEgressStuProfile = 3,
bcmTsnPriMapTypeTafGate = 4,
bcmTsnPriMapTypeCount = 5
} bcm_tsn_pri_map_type_t

bcm_tsn_taf_gate_traverse_cb void* user_data</td><td> Traverse TAF gate</td></tr><tr><td> int int profile_id</td><td> Create destroy profile of maximum bytes that pass through the TAF Definition at line 2030 of file tsn.dox.

◆ DA

endcode<table><tr><th> API</th><th> Brief</th></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t int* group_id</td><td> Create an SR auto learn group</td></tr><tr><td> int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_config_t* config</td><td> Get the information to specified auto learn group ID</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_group_traverse_cb void* user_data</td><td> Traverse all auto learn groups</td></tr><tr><td> int bcm_tsn_sr_auto_learn_config_t* config</td><td> Get the current status of SR auto learn</td></tr></table> section tsn_apis_supervision TSN Supervision A Broadcom proprietary packet match mechanism is provided based on SR HSR PRP protocol as well as Link which supports MAC address and Ether type identification In SR HSR PRP Supervision each DAN node shall multicast a PRP HSR Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceHsrPrpSupervision for detail In each DAN node shall multicast a Supervision frame over both its ports with the format identified by their MAC address and Ether type Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceDot1cbSupervision for detail For link SDK provides MAC address configuration for these packets to be identified as link packets and not to be processed as SR packets Please refer to ref bcm_switch_match_config_add with enumeration type bcmSwitchMatchServiceLinkLocal for detail section tsn_apis_cpu_rx_reason_code TSN SR CPU RX Reason code A Broadcom proprietary threshold mechanism is provided based on TSN please refer to ref rx_reasons_code_table with enumeration type bcmRxReasonSrCounterExceeded for detail In a SR user specified reason code (1~63) from 6-bit binary encoding (bcmRxReasonSrCopyToCpuBit0~5) are used when a user wants to send a packet to CPU and tell the CPU what was the reason for that SR copy to CPU Action. The user-specified reason code can be configured by field API. Please refer to \ref bcm_field_action_t with enumeration type bcmFieldActionSRCopyToCpu and \ref rx_reasons_code_table with enumeration type bcmRxReasonSrCopyToCpuBit0~5 for detail. \section tsn_apis_stat TSN Statistics Management The bcm TSN module allows the user to collect various statistics regarding traffic flowing in the system. The TSN Statistics Management provides Per-Port counters for All ports. In addition it also provides limited number of counters to do Per-Flow counting. Below are the definitions for various TSN statistic types which are shared by both Per-Port and Per-Flow counters endcode<table><tr><th> API</th><th> Brief</th></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_source_t bcm_tsn_stat_t bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_config_t* config</td><td> Configure Get threshold for a specific statistics type on a specific source</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_get (int unit, bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_source_t source, bcm_tsn_stat_t stat, bcm_tsn_stat_threshold_config_t* config) </td> <td> Configure/Get threshold for a specific statistics type on a specific source. </td> </tr> </table> \section tsn_apis_event_notification TSN Event Notification TSN event notification APIs provide users to register the callbacks for interested TSN event on system or port or flow basis. The supports of the event type and source are depending on device capabilities. \anchor tsn_bcm_tsn_event_type_t <table> <caption>bcm_tsn_event_type_t endcode<table><tr><th> API</th><th> Brief</th></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_event_type_t bcm_tsn_event_source_t bcm_tsn_event_cb void* user_data</td><td> Register unregister a callback function for handling TSN events</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_event_notification_traverse_cb void* user_data</td><td> Traverse all registered event notification callbacks</td></tr></table> section tsn_apis_tsn_flow TSN Flows A TSN cut through service MTU STU checking and Time Aware Scheduling Remote nodes or particular streams from remote nodes can be identified as TSN flows by associating L2 addresses Individual TSN flows are identified in SDK as flow ID with type bcm_tsn_tsn_flow_t To support multiple TSN flows with differenet packet priorities sharing the same MAC DA

The supports of the event type and source are depending on device capabilities. \anchor tsn_bcm_tsn_event_type_t <table> <caption>bcm_tsn_event_type_t endcode<table><tr><th> API</th><th> Brief</th></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_event_type_t bcm_tsn_event_source_t bcm_tsn_event_cb void* user_data</td><td> Register unregister a callback function for handling TSN events</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_event_notification_traverse_cb void* user_data</td><td> Traverse all registered event notification callbacks</td></tr></table> section tsn_apis_tsn_flow TSN Flows A TSN cut through service MTU STU checking and Time Aware Scheduling Remote nodes or particular streams from remote nodes can be identified as TSN flows by associating L2 addresses Individual TSN flows are identified in SDK as flow ID with type bcm_tsn_tsn_flow_t To support multiple TSN flows with differenet packet priorities sharing the same MAC TSN flow sets (bcm_tsn_tsn_flowset_t) are introduced in SDK to identify a set of TSN flows that are used together to be associated with one L2 address. A TSN flow set can contain only single flow so that packets with the same MAC-DA belong to one TSN flow regardless of the packet priority. <table> <caption>Flags for TSN flow configuration bcm_tsn_flow_config_t</caption> <tr> <td>BCM_TSN_FLOW_CONFIG_DO_NOT_CUT_THROUGH</td> <td>Do not cut-through for the flow</td> </tr> </table> Configuration structure for TSN flows endcode<table><tr><th> API</th><th> Brief</th></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_pri_map_t bcm_tsn_flow_config_t* default_config

The supports of the event type and source are depending on device capabilities. \anchor tsn_bcm_tsn_event_type_t <table> <caption>bcm_tsn_event_type_t endcode<table><tr><th> API</th><th> Brief</th></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_event_type_t bcm_tsn_event_source_t bcm_tsn_event_cb void* user_data</td><td> Register unregister a callback function for handling TSN events</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_event_notification_traverse_cb void* user_data</td><td> Traverse all registered event notification callbacks</td></tr></table> section tsn_apis_tsn_flow TSN Flows A TSN cut through service MTU STU checking and Time Aware Scheduling Remote nodes or particular streams from remote nodes can be identified as TSN flows by associating L2 addresses Individual TSN flows are identified in SDK as flow ID with type bcm_tsn_tsn_flow_t To support multiple TSN flows with differenet packet priorities sharing the same MAC TSN flow sets (bcm_tsn_tsn_flowset_t) are introduced in SDK to identify a set of TSN flows that are used together to be associated with one L2 address. A TSN flow set can contain only single flow so that packets with the same MAC-DA belong to one TSN flow regardless of the packet priority. <table> <caption>Flags for TSN flow configuration bcm_tsn_flow_config_t</caption> <tr> <td>BCM_TSN_FLOW_CONFIG_DO_NOT_CUT_THROUGH</td> <td>Do not cut-through for the flow</td> </tr> </table> Configuration structure for TSN flows endcode<table><tr><th> API</th><th> Brief</th></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_pri_map_t bcm_tsn_flow_config_t bcm_tsn_flowset_t* flowset</td><td> Create a TSN flow set</td></tr><tr><td> bcm_tsn_flowset_t flowset
